"Singing in Viet Nam Talking Blues" (or "'''Singin' in Viet Nam Talkin' Blues'''") is a song written and originally recorded by Johnny Cash.
Released in May 1971 as the second single (Columbia 4-45393, with "You've Got a New Light Shining" on the opposite side)--> the song reached #18 on U.S. Billboard country chart and #124 on Billboard's Bubbling Under the Hot 100.

References

"Singing in Vietnam Talking Blues" tells the story of Cash's tour of Vietnam and concludes that, "if I ever go back over there anymore/I hope there's none of our boysboys there for me to sing for," because they've all "come back home to stay in peace,"
https://books.google.ru/books?id=KgBMAAAAYAAJ&q=%22tells+the+story+of+Cash%27s+tour+of%22
Cash himself contributed “You've Got a New Light Shining inYour Eyes,” on which he sings about the glow surrounding his lover.
https://books.google.ru/books?id=ufYTBQAAQBAJ&pg=PT179&lpg=PT179&dq=%22cash+himself+contributed+you%22
-->
